settings.title: Simply Foods was established in 1960 with the motto, “Quality is our Brand and Responsibility”
settings.content: We are proud to be one of the largest food manufacturers specializing in premium vegetarian instant ramen and rice products which are both healthy and convenient to use. We also put emphasis on the quality of our spring roll paper, pho noodles, vermicelli and other products, so our customers know they are getting the best.

settings.title: All of the raw materials used to make Simply Food’s pho noodles, spring roll paper, and vermicelli are rigorously tested and guaranteed to meet our high standards before being delivered to consumers.
settings.content: We select suppliers for our fine vermicelli, spring roll paper, and other vegetarian ramen products who are committed to ensuring food safety, environmental responsibility, the health and social welfare of their workers, and product quality assurance. We take quality seriously and don’t include harmful colorants or additives in our pho, spring roll paper, or fine vermicelli. We carefully select, prepare, pack, and ship our products so they can be enjoyed by consumers all around the world.

settings.title: Simply Food considers quality the most important requirement for our food products. With 60 years of experience in providing the highest standard of vegetarian ramen and rice products, Simply Foods products have gained a loyal following around the world. We have rice paper, pho noodles, fine vermicelli, and more.

settings.big_banners_1_text2:
Our Process Begins with
Quality Ingredients
settings.big_banners_2_text3: Last chance to take advantage of our incredible prices!
settings.big_banners_3_text3: Last chance to take advantage of our incredible prices!

settings.text3: As a well-known vegetarian food brand, Simply Food is committed to consumer health, and does not use food coloring, additives, or low quality spices. Our skilled workers are trained on food safety standards to comply with all food safety regulations.

settings.text2:
Carefully Selected Materials

Our noodles are made from high-quality wheat flour, water, and turmeric extract for yellow color.

Spice packages are made from refined salt, refined oil, dried vegetables. None of our products include any harmful colorants or additives.

Lamination & Cutting

The mixed dough is transferred to plate rolling equipment by a conveyor system where it is rolled and then cut to the appropriate size.

Steaming

Next, the noodles are steamed using high pressure and elevated temperature to prepare them for packaging.

Cutting and Shaping

After being drained, the noodles are stretched, cut into slices, dried, and then shaped before frying.

Frying

Frying noodles helps to reduce moisture and shape the noodle before packing. In addition, the frying temperature helps to preserve the noodles and kills any bacteria or microorganisms that may otherwise occur.

Cooling

Noodles are cooled quickly using fresh wind taken from the natural environment and filtered by modern equipment .

Packing

Noodles are packed and sealed, with expiration dates printed clearly.

Shipping

The freshest, cleanest and most delicious noodle packages are delivered to supermarkets, distributors, and retailers to be enjoyed by consumers around the world.

settings.big_banners_1_text2: Simply Food specializes in manufacturing premium instant ramen and rice products
settings.big_banners_2_text3: Last chance to take advantage of our incredible prices!
settings.big_banners_3_text3: Last chance to take advantage of our incredible prices!

settings.text3: As a family business established in 1960, Simply Food takes pride in our careful selection of ingredients, our modern and meticulous processing of noodles, and our focus on quality. We are proud to be one of the largest food manufacturers specializing in premium vegetarian instant ramen and rice products, which are both healthy and convenient to use.

settings.text2:
As a leading manufacturer of premium rice and noodle products, our focus is on providing the highest quality vegetarian items that are healthy and easy to use.
  • High Quality
    Carefully selected ingredients
  • Healthy
    No preservatives or additives
  • Vegetarian
    Premium vegetarian instant ramen and rice products
  • Convenient
    Easy to use without compromising on quality

settings.text1: Quality is our Brand and Responsibility
settings.text2: We take our commitment to quality seriously and stand by our products. All of the ingredients we use are carefully inspected and do not contain any harmful colorants or additives. When you buy from Simply Foods, you know you are buying quality.
Our manufacturing and production facilities adhere to HACCP and ISO standards, and are certified Halal and Kosher.

settings.short-description: Here at District One Kitchen and Bar in Las Vegas that Modern Pho' experience that you have been looking for, look no further. We are a highly acclaimed Kitchen & Bar Resturant. Looking for a nice evening out with a special someone or a family gathering, we have what you are looking for. Inventive Vietnamese & Asian fusion dishes & craft cocktails offered in a stylish, intimate space. Join us for the Pho'Lobster Soup!

settings.quote-content: We loved this place! The food packs a lot of flavor, generous portions; and priced right! I had a delicious pear cocktail that was sweet with a lovely spicy end note. A new favorite place!

settings.ingredient-item: 1/2 cup powdered sugar + a little extra for the circles

settings.step-content: In a pan, mix the powdered sugar, glucose and water. Heat gently while stirring. Pour the caramel onto a silicone mat or sheet of baking paper and leave to cool.

When the caramel has set hard, grind it into a fine powder using a food processor or pestle and mortar. Use a small sieve to sift the powder into circular 5-6 cm diameter stencils on a lined baking tray. Place in the oven for a few seconds to melt the caramel into circles, remove and leave to cool. Reduce the oven temperature to 200°F.

Grease eight circles of 5-6 cm in diameter with butter and sprinkle with icing sugar. Whisk the egg whites until they form stiff peaks, then add the icing sugar. Transfer into a piping bag and pipe the egg white mixture in the middle of circles, higher around the sides, to form a well in the centre. Carefully place 1 tbsp of crème anglaise in this well, cover with more egg white mix, and smooth over with a spatula.

settings.chef-bio:
Chef Khai Vu came to the states at the young age of 11 and has taken to a professional path of cooking. Inspiration from his grandmother and the family business started by his father paved the way for Chef Khai to produce some of the most modern and high quality Vietnamese cuisine.

With over 20 years of experience in the hospitality business, Chef Khai Vu has opened many popular restaurants including: District One, Pho So 1, Viet Noodle Le Pho, and many more.
